Mayor, Place 1
==============

Jason Ward was elected mayor in November, 2021, and is serving his third term as mayor. Prior to his election as mayor, he served on Place 7 of the Benbrook City Council.

He was born in Dallas, raised in Llano, Texas and is a graduate from Texas State University – San Marcos where he met his wife, Robin, in 1994.  They have lived in Benbrook with their son, Elijah, since 2008.

Mr. Ward served two years on the Economic Development Corporation Board of Directors, 2 years on the Zoning Board of Adjustments/Board of Appeals and 2 years on the Parks & Recreation Board.  Other areas of service in Benbrook include 3 years on the advisory board at his local church, 2 years as Vice President of the Westpark PTA, 4 years serving on the Site Based Decision Making Committees at Westpark Elementary and Benbrook Middle-High School.

Mr. Ward dedicated 19 years to a career in the mental health services field, managing programs that cared for individuals with traumatic brain injury, intellectual disabilities, Alzheimer’s and dementia.  He and his wife now own a Benbrook-based residential painting company that serves Fort Worth and its surrounding communities.
